questions.question: Before the Industrial Revolution began, these resources were needed.

choices.answer: Money for investment and an abundance of farmland.
Old building for factories and electrically powered engines.
A stable food supply and unemployed workers moving to cities
Wood, iron and gold to build machinery.

questions.question: Which statement describes early factories for workers?

choices.answer: 8 hour days, middle class lifestyle, little safety.
Long days, free child care, low pay
Equality for all workers.
Long days, low standard of living, little safety.

questions.question: This is the belief that the government should not interfere with business.

choices.answer: hands- offishness
laissez- faire
communism
bourgeoisie

questions.question: The early power source for factories, mines and railroads came from

choices.answer: enriching uranium for nuclear power.
damming rivers for hydroelectric power.
burning coal for steam power.
burning gasoline in internal combustion machines.

questions.question: System where people sell resources for a profit and supply and demand determines prices.

choices.answer: communism
unionism
capitalism
socialism

questions.question: Which statement best describes the effects of early factories?

choices.answer: Supply increased and people no longer needed necessities.
Conditions were better than workers experienced on farms.
Cities shrank as workers moved to the country for jobs.
Demand increased due to machines making goods cheaper.
Adam Smith
Karl Marx
Papa Smurf
Biggie Smalls

questions.question: What was his belief about the Industrial Revolution?

choices.answer: Workers will revolt and share resources equally.
Survival of the fittest explains why creatures evolve.
Governments should not interfere with business.
Everything is awesome!

questions.question: According to this guy, the proletariat and bourgeoisie were

choices.answer: farmers and city dwellers who competed for resources.
workers and farmers that fought for longer working hours.
farmers and middle class who disagreed about public schools.
workers and the middle class involved in a class struggle.

questions.question: Which nation was the first to industrialize?

choices.answer: France, because Napoleon invested in industry.
Russia, because it was large and had lots of workers.
Britain, because it had a lot of coal and iron.
The Ottoman Empire due to its long coastline.

questions.question: Which nations were slow to industrialize?

choices.answer: Britain, Germany and the US.
Austria, Russia and the Ottoman Empire.
France, the US and China.
China, Russia and Britain

questions.question: Which invention lead to the growth of cities with night life, skyscrapers and telegraph lines?

choices.answer: steam power
internal combustion
electricity
chemical fertilizers

questions.question: Which organization represented workers by negotiating with managers and organizing strikes?

choices.answer: bourgeoisie
unions
capitalists
Luddites

questions.question: This inventor felt so bad about his invention he used the profits to help the world. He was

choices.answer: Alfred Nobel, inventor of dynamite and Nobel Peace Prize.
Karl Marx inventor of electricity and communism
Charles Darwin creator of theory of evolution and lightbulbs
Ned Ludd the destroyer of machines and founder of unions.
The use of machines to aid in farming.
Moving factories to the countryside to find workers.
Opening public schools in large population centers.
Growth of cities when workers move there looking for work.
